intro: Dicrastylis cundeeleensis, commonly known as the Cundeeleensis flat sedge, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, often swampy habitats, and is characterized by its flat, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family. Dicrastylis cundeeleensis is often found in wetlands and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
